channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Indonesia 80th Independence Day
item.description:
Sunday, 17 August 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and White to recognise Indonesia 80th Independence Day

Indonesia Independence Day is commemorating the 80th anniversary of the Proclamation of Independence on 17 August 1945

This Light Up is organised by: Synergy of Indonesia Australia

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Queensland Road Safety Week
item.description:
Monday, 18 August 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Queensland Road Safety Week

Queensland Road Safety Week (QRSW) aims to raise the profile of road safety within communities across the state and is an opportunity for all Queenslanders, from individuals to community groups and private organisations, to show their commitment towards our shared goal of making Queensland roads safer for all road users.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Transport and Main Roads

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Daffodil Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 20 August 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Daffodil Day

Daffodil Day is Cancer Council's most iconic and much-loved fundraising campaign. Daffodil Day is Thursday, 21 August 2025 and is Australia's day to give to cancer research. People across Australia show their support for the people they know (or even those they don't know) who have been impacted by cancer. Supporting Daffodil Day will help vital cancer research and lead Queenslanders in a partnership against cancer.

This Light Up is organised by: Cancer Council Queensland

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Brain Injury Awareness Week
item.description:
Friday, 22 August 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple and Yellow to support Brain Injury Awareness Week

The annual Brain Injury Awareness Week raises awareness of brain injury and its impact. This week also celebrates the achievements of those living with a brain injury and the commitment given to them by their families and the communities they live in. Synapse provides a range of support services for people who have been impacted by a brain injury or disability. These services promote quality of life, self-determination, and choice through information, specialist support, and targeted research activities.

This Light Up is organised by: Synapse Australia

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This week also celebrates the achievements of those living with a brain injury and the commitment given to them by their families and the communities they live in. Synapse provides a range of support services for people who have been impacted by a brain injury or disability. These services promote quality of life, self-determination, and choice through information, specialist support, and targeted research activities.
This Light Up is organised by: Synapse Australia

item.title: Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition
item.description:
Monday, 25 August 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue, Yellow, Green, White and Black to recognise Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition

The Australian South Sea Islander Day of National Recognition, celebrated on August 25th, marks the day that the Federal Government officially recognised Australian South Sea Islander (ASSI) as a distinct cultural group. The ASSI Community aims to recognise this culturally significant occasion's anniversary to increase recognition and raise awareness of our unique history and culture and to pay respect to our South Sea Islander Ancestors and Forebearers.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian South Sea Islanders United Council (Brisbane) Inc.

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:

item.title: Merdeka Day - Malaysian Independence Day
item.description:
Sunday, 31 August 2025

City Hall will be lit Red, White, Blue,and Yellow to recognise Merdeka Day - Malaysian Independence Day

Merdeka Day (Hari Merdeka) commemorates the independence of Malaya which was granted in 31st August 1957. It was a key step in the foundation of Malaysia as a nation and is celebrated as one of Malaysia's national days.

This Light Up is organised by: Australia - Malaysia Business Council (QLD) INC

Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Wattle Day
item.description:
Monday, 1 September 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support National Wattle Day

National Wattle Day occurs on 1 September each year. This Day celebrates all that the Golden Wattle means to the country and creates awareness that it is Australia's national floral emblem, as well as one of the floral emblem's for Brisbane City.

This Light Up is organised by: Wattle Day Association Inc

Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Blood Cancer and Stem Cell Awareness
item.description:
Tuesday, 2 September 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Blood Cancer and Stem Cell Awareness

Blood Cancer and Stem Cell Awareness promotes the Stem Cell register and encourage more to register and donate. Each day, individuals waiting for a stem cell transplant are depend on the generosity of strangers to find a matching donor. Sadly, many still face challenges in locating that match. Through our appeals platform, families, friends, and communities can raise awareness and rally support to help find life-saving donors for their loved ones. By participating in an appeal, you can help boost donor registrations, increasing the odds of finding a match for patients in urgent need.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Bone Marrow Donor Registry

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Women's Health Week 2025
item.description:
Wednesday, 3 September 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support National Women's Health Week 2025

Jean Hailes for Women's Health is a national not-for-profit organisation dedicated to improving women's health across Australia through every life stage. National Women's Health Week (1-5 September 2025) is a celebration of all women in Australia, and we hope to reach women in Brisbane with the message of 'Say Yes to You' for change and action when it comes to staying up to date with vital women's health checks. When women look after their health, it benefits the whole community. This year we are asking the women of Australia to celebrate national women's health week by re-prioritising their own healthcare. This highly visible activation will serve as a powerful public reminder, encouraging women to prioritise their health by scheduling screenings and check-ups that are essential for early detection and prevention of serious health conditions.

This Light Up is organised by: The Jean Hailes Foundation

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, 3 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support Prostate Cancer Awareness Month

September is International Prostate Cancer Awareness Month. The Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia is asking Australia to get involved in helping create awareness and raise the much-needed funds to assist in the fight against prostate cancer and shine a light on this disease. Did you know Prostate Cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australian men with 20,000 diagnoses and close to 3,300 deaths each year? Prostate cancer kills more men than breast cancer kills women. The Prostate Cancer Foundation encourages all men to talk to their GP about testing for prostate cancer, as part of their regular health check-up.

This Light Up is organised by: Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Bigsound
item.description:
Thursday, 4 September 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Purple Orange Pink and Green to support Bigsound

BIGSOUND - run by not-for-profit organisation QMusic - is the southern hemisphere’s biggest music industry gathering where some of the world’s most influential tastemakers and adventurous music lovers come to shape and experience the future of music over three days and nights in Brisbane every September. Launched in 2002 by industry development organisation QMusic, BIGSOUND's community of musical innovation and togetherness attracts attendances of over 16,000. The future of music is discovered at the BIGSOUND Festival, with 150 artists showcasing their talent in venues across Fortitude Valley’s live music precinct; and has given some of the biggest names in Australian music their start, including Flume, Rufus du Sol, Gang of Youths, Lime Cordiale, Tash Sultana, DMA?s, A.B. Original, Ball Park Music, Courtney Barnett, Tones and I, The Jungle Giants, Thelma Plum, Vera Blue, Violent Soho and many more.

This Light Up is organised by: Qmusic

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: PKD Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, 4 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red and White to support PKD Awareness Day

PKD Awareness Day takes place annually on 4 September around the world. It is our day to raise awareness for Polycystic Kidney Disease. PKD is a lifelong, genetic disease that worsens over time as fluid-filled cysts form and enlarge both kidneys, often leading to kidney failure. It affects more than 25,000 Australians and millions worldwide, however, as a rare genetic disease there are many people who have never heard of it. Together, we can change that! The more people that know about PKD, the closer we can get to additional treatments and a cure!

This Light Up is organised by: PKD Australia 

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: VIEW Club's 65th Anniversary
item.description:
Thursday, 4 September 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support 65th Anniversary

In 2025 VIEW will be celebrating its 65th anniversary. VIEW (Voice, Interests, and Education of Women) is a national women's volunteer organisation with over 13,000 members share the common purpose of exclusively supporting the children’s education charity, The Smith Family. VIEW Clubs’ long-standing connection with The Smith Family helps it support young Australians experiencing poverty to overcome their circumstances and reach their full potential by providing long-term, wrap-around support for their education. For 65 years VIEW has connected with others in the community, enabling The Smith Family to reach more families in need, providing an important source of volunteers, fundraising and connection in local communities. Today VIEW is proudly the largest community sponsor of the Learning for Life program supporting over 1,800 students.

This Light Up is organised by: VIEW Clubs

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Friday, 5 September 2025

City Hall will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane. We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Awareness Month
item.description:
Tuesday, 9 September 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Awareness Month

September 9 is Red Shoes Rock Day! An international day of awareness of Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD). At 9:09 on the 9th day of the 9th month people across Australia, and around the world, collectively take a minute to pause and reflect on the struggles faced by individuals and families living with FASD.

This Light Up is organised by: Foundation for Alcohol Research and Education

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by:

item.title: World Sepsis Day
item.description:
Saturday, 13 September 2025

City Hall will be lit Magenta to support World Sepsis Day

Sepsis is the final common pathway to death from most infectious diseases. Despite being a medical emergency, Sepsis is still not getting the attention it deserves. Awareness Saves Lives. Learn about Sepsis at www.worldsepsisday.org

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Health QLD

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: National Bilby Day
item.description:
Sunday, 14 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green to support National Bilby Day

National Bilby Day is more than a date on the calendar, it’s a heartfelt, nationwide call to action to protect one of Australia’s most iconic and endangered marsupials: the Greater Bilby. Established in 2005, thanks to the tireless efforts of conservationist Frank Manthey OAM, co-founder of Save the Bilby Fund. Remarkably, it remains the only gazetted national day in Australia dedicated to a native species, a powerful recognition of just how important the bilby is to our natural heritage. 2025 Marks the 20th Anniversary of National Bilby Day, with a wish to make this milestone year the biggest and boldest yet, for the bilbies, for biodiversity, and for future generations.

This Light Up is organised by: Save the Bilby Fund

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival

item.title: Costa Rica Independence Day
item.description:
Monday, 15 September 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue, White, Red to celebrate Costa Rica Independence Day

Costa Rica's National Day is September 15th, which is Independence Day. It commemorates the nation's declaration of independence from Spain in 1821.

This Light Up is organised by: Embassy of the Republic of Costa Rica

item.title: Dementia Action Week
item.description:
Monday, 15 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Teal to support Dementia Action Week

Dementia Action Week 2025 will be held from Monday 15 to Sunday 21 September, and includes World Alzheimer’s Day on Sunday 21 September. Dementia Action Week is a major leadership, awareness and advocacy campaign led by Dementia Australia as the peak body for people living with dementia, their families and carers in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Dementia Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Papua New Guinea's 50th Independence Day and Cultural Celebrations
item.description:
Tuesday, 16 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red, Yellow, Black to celebrate Papua New Guinea's 50th Independence Day and Cultural Celebrations

Papua New Guinea is celebrating and commemorating its 50th year of independence from mama country, Australia back in Sept 16 1975. The PNG Federation Qld Inc has helped to promote and maintain PNG's rich cultural heritage and national identity amongst QLD's multicultural society and amongst others to foster an environment of friendship and unity among PNG former residents and friends over this time. The National Day will be celebrated with a cultural activities or activity promoting the diverse 800 or so languages of PNG with arts, craft and stall along with celebrations from other multicultural dancers from Pacific islands and Indigenous cultures.

This Light Up is organised by: Papua New Guinea Federation QLD Inc

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Brisbane Pride Festival
item.description:
Saturday, 20 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Rainbow to celebrate the Brisbane Pride Festival

Brisbane Pride organise and co-ordinate events of celebration, commemoration and information and engage in other activities, as part of the LGBTIQA+ community in Queensland. To promote mental health and wellness and raise community funds to provide assistance in the form of grants or assistance.

The Brisbane Pride Festival serves as a major fundraiser for Brisbane Pride, raising vital funds to improve the sense of community, mental health and the well-being of the LGBTIQA+ communities

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Pride Festival Inc.

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Light it for MITO
item.description:
Sunday, 21 September 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Green to support Light it for MITO

World Mitochondrial Disease Week runs from 16 to 22 September 2024. The Lighting international landmarks helps to raise awareness for mitochondrial disease (mito), a little-known but devastating genetic disease with no cure.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Mitochondrial Disease Foundation Limited

Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Global ITP Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, 22 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support Global ITP Awareness Week

ITP Australia was founded 5 years ago by our CEO Danielle Boyle, to help provide people living with this rare condition with up-to-date Australian information, support, and advocacy on their behalf. Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP) is a rare autoimmune disease where the body’s immune system attacks platelets. Platelets assist the blood to clot and patients with ITP have a low platelet count. Patients with ITP can suffer from a vast range of symptoms and there is no cure.

This Light Up is organised by: ITP Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

item.title: Police Remembrance Day Vigil and Memorial Service
item.description:
Thursday, 25 September 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Blue to commemorate the Police Remembrance Day Vigil and Memorial Service

With honour, they served. The sacrifice made by officers who have lost their lives in service to our community is never forgotten. The annual candlelight vigil is a traditional commemoration that takes place throughout Queensland, held prior to National Police Remembrance Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Queensland Literary Awards
item.description:
Friday, 26 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue and Gold to celebrate the Queensland Literary Awards

The Queensland Literary Awards showcase outstanding authors from across Australia, celebrating emerging and established authors across a range of genres. State Library of Queensland is proud to manage the Awards in collaboration with sponsors, the literary community, and industry partners. The awards celebrate outstanding creatives, foster partnerships, and honour the work of First Nations writers as important storytellers. State Library has worked to build partnerships with the literary community locally and across Australia to reward excellence in literature and encourage new and emerging writers, fostering a love of books and literature to the public.

This Light Up is organised by: State Library of Queensland

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

item.title: National Police Remembrance Day
item.description:
Monday, 29 September 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to commemorate National Police Remembrance Day 

National Police Remembrance Day (NPRD) recognises annually the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers who have died whilst on duty. It falls on the 29th of September each year. Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and Southwest Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honour those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
